Text saved: Understanding that people from different cultures can have different expectations and behaviour can help us avoid communication problems. However, it is also very important to remember that using cultural **stereotypes**, which are simple but often untrue ideas about what a group of people is like, can be bad for building good business relationships. Although our national culture can affect how we behave and think, we are also mainly influenced by other things like the region we come from, the communities we are part of, our age and gender, our company's culture, and our own personal experiences. Therefore, our knowledge of possible differences should be something we keep in mind, rather than something we use to label all the people from an entire nation in the same way.
